Light beam enters optical fiber perpendicular to horizontal end face A.
Angle of incidence at the interface must be greater than the critical angle for total internal reflection.
Total path length of light beam in optical fiber is 2πr.
Distance d is horizontal distance between ends of semicircle, given by 2R sin(θ).

Minimum radius r occurs when angle of incidence is exactly the critical angle.
Solve equation r² = (d/2)² + (R - D/2)² ensuring angle of incidence is greater than critical angle.
Minimum radius r is r ≥ D/2 √((N² - 1)/N²).
